ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Medication status
Notes: 0=No medication; 1=Medication; 2 = Drug Naive

ElementDescription: What is the subject's source of income?

ElementDescription: Income source: specify
What was the total of the subject's personal income (before taxes) from all sources in the last year?
What was the total family income (before taxes) from all sources within the subject's household in the last year?

Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: How frequently does the subject  participate in cognitively stimulating activities?
Notes: 1 = Daily; 2= More than once per week; 3= Once per week; 4= 2-4 times per month; 5= About once per mont; 6= 5-9 times per year; 7= 2-4 times per year; 8= About once per year; -88=NA

Notes: 0=No; 1=Yes

ElementDescription: How frequently does the subject participate in socially engaging activities?
Notes: 1 = Daily; 2= More than once per week; 3= Once per week; 4= 2-4 times per month; 5= About once per mont; 6= 5-9 times per year; 7= 2-4 times per year; 8= About once per year; -88=NA

Notes: 1=Very Happy; 2= Happy; 3= Not very happy; 4 = Not happy at all

Notes: 1 = Excellent; 2= Very Good; 3= Good; 4= Fair; 5= Poor

ElementDescription: Television is the subject's primary form of entertainment.
Notes: 1= agree strongly; 2= agree somewhat; 3= disagree somewhat; 4= disagree strongly

Site
Notes: Study Site

ElementDescription: Did the participant meet criteria for Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI)?
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes

ElementDescription: Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) subtypes that the participant met criteria for
Notes: 1 = Single Domain Amnestic; 2 = Single Domain Non-Amnestic; 3 = Multiple Domain Amnestic; 4 = Multiple Domain Non-Amnestic

ElementDescription: Mild Cognitive Impairment (MCI) domains that the participant met criteria for
Notes: 1 = MCI Memory (HVLT Immediate Recall, BVMT Immediate Recall, HVLT Delayed Recall, BVMT Delayed Recall, HVLT Recognition, and BVMTRecognition); 2 = MCI Attention (Oral Trails A and Digit Span Forward); 3 = MCI Language (Animal Fluency, Verbal Fluency, and MINT); 4 = MCI Executive Functioning (Oral Trails B, LN span and D-KEFS Condition 3)

ElementDescription: What is your current relationship status?
Notes: 1 = Single, never married; 2 = Single, divorced; 3 = Single, widowed; 4 = Married; 5 = Married, separated; 6 =  In a relationship
